messages.body:
BofA $MYOK : $BMY to acquire MYOK for 61% premium; change to No Rating 
$BMY has agreed to acquire  $MYOK at 61% premium for $225/sh or $13.1bn in cash; Deal expected to close in 4Q. We change to No Rating as the stock is no longer trading on its fundamentals
MYOK Swings Higher on Buyout Buzz $BMY $MYOK https://talkmarkets.com/content/stocks--equities/myok-swings-higher-on-buyout-buzz?post=280137

links.title: MYOK Swings Higher on Buyout Buzz
links.description: Bristol-Meyers Squibb (BMY) announced this morning that it was buying heart drug developer MyoKardia Inc (Nasdaq: MYOK) for $13 billion, or $225 per share in cash, as a way to boost its portfolio of heart disease treatments. The shares of MYOK are trading at a record high in response, up 58.3% at $220.92 at last check.

messages.body: (MYOK) Alert: Johnson Fistel Investigates Proposed Sale of MyoKardia; Is $225 a Fair Price? https://marketwirenews.com/articles/-myok-alert-johnson-fistel-investigates-proposed-sal-8142813907556659.html?i=c $MYOK News Article

links.title: (MYOK) Alert: Johnson Fistel Investigates Proposed Sale of MyoKardia; Is $225 a Fair Price?
links.description: SAN DIEGO , Oct. 5, 2020 /PRNewswire/ -- Shareholder rights law firm Johnson Fistel, LLP has launched an investigation into whether the board members of MyoKardia, Inc. ("MyoKardia" or the "Company") (NASDAQ: MYOK) breached their fiduciary duties in connection with the proposed sale of the Company to Bristol Myers Squibb (NYSE: BMY).

links.title: Does 'Aggressive' Bristol-Myers Have the Right Prescription for Investors?
links.description: What was it, a month ago? Not even. I looked it up. I am referring to the Merck ( MRK) deal or deals with Seattle Genetics ( SGEN) . While Seattle Genetics remains an independent company in the wake of those agreements, Merck did become an investor in that firm at a premium while doing what larger pharmaceutical names always do when they need to.

https://newsfilter.io/a/bc1ec2714617ede47400b068a5c604e8

links.title: Bristol Myers expands heart drug business with $13 billion deal for MyoKardia
links.description: (Reuters) - Bristol Myers Squibb Co said on Monday it would buy MyoKardia Inc for about $13 billion to bolster its portfolio of heart disease treatments, as it seeks to reduce some of its dependence on cancer drugs.

links.title: Briefing.com
links.description: Futures take a hit overnight in response to President Trump and the First Lady testing positive for covid-19. Employment data disappoints adding to the weakness as the final quarter of the year gets underway.Expectations for October ahead of the US Election in early November are choppy at best.
